definition:
&%HotelFrontDesk is a &%subOrganization
of a &%TravelerAccommodation that takes charge of all &%CheckInService and
&%CheckOutService transactions.  They often do other miscellaneous things too at the
request of the hotel &%guest
opposite_reasoning: BackOffice provides the strongest semantic opposition for HotelFrontDesk within organizational context. It captures the fundamental front/back, public/private, customer-facing/internal dichotomy that is conceptually clear and functionally meaningful. This opposition would be useful for Fisher-LDA as it distinguishes between external-facing service entities and internal operational entities. While not directly related to deception detection, it establishes useful spatial and functional boundaries in organizational ontology. The concept is likely in WordNet and should be added to SUMO if missing.
